title: Rust fails to deduce `enumerate()` range

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
pub fn iter_too(v: &[u32]){
    for (i, _) in v.iter().enumerate(){
        assert!(i <= v.len());
    }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: Assertions is removed because it is always false.

Instead, this happened: Generated code contains loop, check and panic.

```asm
example::iter_too:
        lea     rax, [4*rsi + 4]
        mov     rcx, -1
.LBB0_1:
        add     rax, -4
        je      .LBB0_4
        add     rcx, 1
        cmp     rcx, rsi
        jbe     .LBB0_1
        push    rax
        lea     rdi, [rip + .L__unnamed_1]
        lea     rdx, [rip + .L__unnamed_2]
        mov     esi, 30
        call    qword ptr [rip + core::panicking::panic@GOTPCREL]
        ud2
.LBB0_4:
        ret
```

Surprisingly, compiler is able to understand that `i < v.len()`

This code
```rust
pub fn iter_too(v: &[u32]){
    for (i, _) in v.iter().enumerate(){
        assert!(i < v.len());
    }
}
```
compiles into
```asm
example::iter_too:
        ret
```

[godbolt link](https://godbolt.org/#z:OYLghAFBqd5TKALEBjA9gEwKYFFMCWALugE4A0BIEAZgQDbYB2AhgLbYgDkAjF%%2BIwmEDmSzlSppJxMVzuJq%2BfzVyZ9GLxHKpIQjbxlNtVJvFfpjCptKqdYa1rItIftISj7rBXr9luDLqdgzjep96Y8ObyxbLbhrTbbXbY0iHdDHM7K24PZ6vWIfPFcwmCUhgiFQmHBOmI08otFMBipBYjinw/M%2BRJAiSZJEBS4LUi4FxPG8P4MkySGsoSPIAhyQYOkK7qauKUoynKCrLMqLz8AGOgzHMSDYCwOAxCihjcE65AurEboevwXo%2Bn66qanR5C6vqhpfMaprmlaNp2mxXBPMKRH8UJgZzCGCDwBAYboGwCQMNEMYQBg%2BmGTETAEMASBEPQACeAgMKevoQBERERMEdR2dwaqmRwwgAPJMPZRE4GwxjAJIeaEKQw4ECc2C%2Bnm2DqG0ZjYj5/DBNiDpivQBARMBpB2W4OCZeqpAEC6vBBjQRjAEoABqBDYAA7gFCTMOVyaiOIkgZj12YaERBaGBFJYyoYBW%2BpAczoAkVRJQAtLS81EEtjAJfQSFvE8GxLUt2CEFUO0Wj4aqtNO3gQM4q48H4gTzlM/R%2BD2aR3YkyTtkwm4DuWcUzkMDTjl2k4VoDExPc29brsDmRdsuG5Q4uszzHu6YVdgiZ4YKyl5l6pZEKgGyWdZtl2WC0plhskYkG%%2BBszN62zqqc2ptH0YxzHUIfjrOq6x9PSK2sIJGiWpRK835j4IWIsxYSx8FLBSSlAF8WAWAkSDofB4yAd6d%2B4CEqkBSI4aQQA%3D%3D%3D)

bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

stable 1.57 affected too.
